name: Push-Up
description: A push-up is a common calisthenics exercise beginning from the prone position. By raising and lowering the body using the arms, push-ups exercise the pectoral muscles, triceps, and anterior deltoids.
instructions: Place your hands on the ground, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Extend your legs back, so you are balanced on your hands and toes.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the ground.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.

name: Bulgarian Split Squats
description: The Bulgarian Split Squat is an excellent exercise to build lower body strength and balance. It primarily targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. The rear-foot-elevated position allows for greater range of motion and increased activation of the target muscles.
instructions: Stand a couple of feet from a bench, facing away.
Place one foot on the bench behind you.
Lower your hips to bring your front thigh near horizontal.
Keep your torso upright throughout the movement.
Press your front heel to return to the starting position.

name: Standing Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: The Standing Dumbbell Shoulder Press is a fundamental upper body exercise that targets the deltoids, triceps, and upper trapezius. Performing the exercise standing engages the core and improves overall stability.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at shoulder height.
Press the dumbbells overhead until arms are fully extended.
Lower the weights with control back to shoulder height.

name: Plank
description: The Plank is a core exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for an extended period. It targets the abdominal muscles, lower back, and shoulders.
instructions: Place your forearms on the ground, elbows directly beneath your shoulders.
Extend your legs back, so you are balanced on your forearms and toes.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Hold this position for the prescribed time.

name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Row
description: The Dumbbell Bent-Over Row is a compound exercise that targets the upper back, lats, and biceps. It is an effective movement to improve strength and muscle development in the back.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding dumbbells in front of thighs.
Hinge at the hips to bring the torso close to parallel with the ground.
Pull the dumbbells towards your hips, squeezing the shoulder blades together.
Lower the weights back to the starting position.
